title: PS4 controllers will work on PS5, but only for supported PS4 games

body: What a bunch of rubes buying Sony's bullshit. There is no technical reason for this, they just hate people being able to use their product without forking over cash. Fuck Sony. You need to be a paste eating retard to buy into a system like that today. There are no exclusive games good enough to pay that much and put up with that much bullshit, and you still have to pay per month for online.
body_html: What a bunch of rubes buying Sony's bullshit. There is no technical reason for this, they just hate people being able to use their product without forking over cash. Fuck Sony. You need to be a paste eating retard to buy into a system like that today. There are no exclusive games good enough to pay that much and put up with that much bullshit, and you still have to pay per month for online.

Part of the Apolitical Guilds Union
guild.name: gaming

post.title: PS4 controllers will work on PS5, but only for supported PS4 games

body: Fair enough on the exclusives. The argument for PC gaming just gets stronger each generation imo. It would be nice to have all the systems. The reality is, most people can only afford one system whether their constraint is cash or time. The cost over time for a solid entry level PC vs a PS4 (and presumably more so for the PS5) when including the monthly service doesn't make sense over the lifetime of the console. If you bought a PS4 at launch and renewed the service every year at the best price, you spent over $800 and haven't bought any games yet. Spending $800 on a PC just makes more sense to me, since it's also a computer when you aren't playing games. The worst part about the Playstation since 3 is the monthly charge for online. That spreads the cost of the console out. The lower barrier to entry is what makes it attractive, and people's gullibility for anything that's cheaper right now without respect for what it will cost down the line is why PS4 is at the top of the console heap. Now that Sony has their hooks into so many people, they are going to be draconian as fuck with PS5 because they have that damned corporate hubris and think they are untouchable again.
body_html: Fair enough on the exclusives. The argument for PC gaming just gets stronger each generation imo. It would be nice to have all the systems. The reality is, most people can only afford one system whether their constraint is cash or time. The cost over time for a solid entry level PC vs a PS4 (and presumably more so for the PS5) when including the monthly service doesn't make sense over the lifetime of the console. If you bought a PS4 at launch and renewed the service every year at the best price, you spent over $800 and haven't bought any games yet. Spending $800 on a PC just makes more sense to me, since it's also a computer when you aren't playing games. The worst part about the Playstation since 3 is the monthly charge for online. That spreads the cost of the console out. The lower barrier to entry is what makes it attractive, and people's gullibility for anything that's cheaper right now without respect for what it will cost down the line is why PS4 is at the top of the console heap. Now that Sony has their hooks into so many people, they are going to be draconian as fuck with PS5 because they have that damned corporate hubris and think they are untouchable again.
